text: The word of the Lord that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, you elders,
And listen, all inhabitants of the land.
Has anything like this happened in your days,
Or in your fathers’ days?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell your sons about it,
And have your sons tell their sons,
And their sons the next generation.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Awake, you heavy drinkers, and weep;
And wail, all you wine drinkers,
Because of the sweet wine,
For it has been eliminated from your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a nation has invaded my land,
Mighty and without number;
Its teeth are the teeth of a lion,
And it has the jaws of a lioness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It has made my vine a waste
And my fig tree a stump.
It has stripped them bare and hurled them away;
Their branches have become white.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wail like a virgin clothed with sackcloth
For the groom of her youth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The grain offering and the drink offering have been cut off
From the house of the Lord.
The priests mourn,
The ministers of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The field is ruined,
The land mourns;
For the grain is ruined,
The new wine has dried up,
Fresh oil has failed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be ashamed, you farm workers,
Wail, you vinedressers,
For the wheat and the barley;
Because the harvest of the field is destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The vine has dried up
And the fig tree has withered;
The pomegranate, the palm also, and the apple tree,
All the trees of the field have dried up.
Indeed, joy has dried up
From the sons of mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put on sackcloth
And mourn, you priests;
Wail, you ministers of the altar!
Come, spend the night in sackcloth,
You ministers of my God,
For the grain offering and the drink offering
Have been withheld from the house of your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consecrate a fast,
Proclaim a solemn assembly;
Gather the elders
And all the inhabitants of the land
To the house of the Lord your God,
And cry out to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe for the day!
For the day of the Lord is near,
And it will come as destruction from the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Has food not been cut off before our eyes, and
Joy and rejoicing from the house of our God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The seeds have dried up under their shovels;
The storehouses have become desolate,
The grain silos are ruined,
Because the grain has dried up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How the animals have groaned!
The herds of cattle have wandered aimlessly
Because there is no pasture for them;
Even the flocks of sheep have suffered.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Blow a trumpet in Zion,
And sound an alarm on My holy mountain!
Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble,
For the day of the Lord is coming;
Indeed, it is near,
speaker: Narrator

text:
A day of darkness and gloom,
A day of clouds and thick darkness.
As dawn is spread over the mountains,
So there is a great and mighty people;
There has never been anything like it,
Nor will there be again after it
To the years of many generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fire consumes before them,
And behind them a flame devours.
The land is like the Garden of Eden before them,
But a desolate wilderness behind them,
And nothing at all escapes them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their appearance is like the appearance of horses;
And like war horses, so they run.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With a noise as of chariots
They leap about on the tops of the mountains,
Like the crackling of a flame of fire consuming the stubble,
Like a mighty people drawn up for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before them the people are in anguish;
All faces turn pale.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They run like warriors,
They climb the wall like soldiers;
And each of them marches in line,
Nor do they lose their way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They do not crowd each other,
Every warrior of them marches in his path;
When they burst through the defenses,
They do not break ranks.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They storm the city,
They run on the wall;
They climb into the houses,
They enter through the windows like a thief.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before them the earth quakes,
The heavens tremble,
The sun and the moon become dark,
And the stars lose their brightness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord utters His voice before His army;
His camp is indeed very great,
For mighty is one who carries out His word.
The day of the Lord is indeed great and very awesome,
And who can endure it?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And tear your heart and not merely your garments.”
Now return to the Lord your God,
For He is gracious and compassionate,
Slow to anger, abounding in mercy
And relenting of catastrophe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who knows, He might turn and relent,
And leave a blessing behind Him,
Resulting in a grain offering and a drink offering
For the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blow a trumpet in Zion,
Consecrate a fast, proclaim a solemn assembly,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gather the people, sanctify the congregation,
Assemble the elders,
Gather the children and the nursing infants.
Have the groom come out of his room
And the bride out of her bridal chamber.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the priests, the Lord’s ministers,
Weep between the porch and the altar,
And let them say, “Spare Your people, Lord,
And do not make Your inheritance a disgrace,
With the nations jeering at them.
Why should those among the peoples say,
‘Where is their God?’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the Lord will be zealous for His land,
And will have compassion for His people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will answer and say to His people,
“Behold, I am going to send you grain, new wine, and oil,
And you will be satisfied in full with them;
And I will never again make you a disgrace among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will remove the northern army far from you,
And I will drive it into a dry and desolate land,
Its advance guard into the eastern sea,
And its rear guard into the western sea.
And its stench will ascend and its odor of decay will come up,
Because it has done great things.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not fear, land; shout for joy and rejoice,
For the Lord has done great things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not fear, animals of the field,
For the pastures of the wilderness have turned green,
For the tree has produced its fruit,
The fig tree and the vine have yielded in full.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So shout for joy, you sons of Zion,
And rejoice in the Lord your God;
For He has given you the early rain for your vindication.
And He has brought down for you the rain,
The early and latter rain as before.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The threshing floors will be full of grain,
And the vats will overflow with the new wine and oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Then I will compensate you for the years
That the swarming locust has eaten,
The creeping locust, the stripping locust, and the gnawing locust—
My great army which I sent among you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will have plenty to eat and be satisfied,
And you will praise the name of the Lord your God,
Who has dealt wondrously with you;
Then My people will never be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So you will know that I am in the midst of Israel,
And that I am the Lord your God
And there is no other;
And My people will never be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“It will come about after this
That I will pour out My Spirit on all mankind;
And your sons and your daughters will prophesy,
Your old men will have dreams,
Your young men will see visions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And even on the male and female servants
I will pour out My Spirit in those days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will display wonders in the sky and on the earth,
Blood, fire, and columns of smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun will be turned into darkness,
And the moon into blood,
Before the great and awesome day of the Lord comes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it will come about that everyone who calls on the name of the Lord
Will be saved;
For on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem
There will be those who escape,
Just as the Lord has said,
Even among the survivors whom the Lord calls.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For behold, in those days and at that time,
When I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will gather all the nations
And bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat.
Then I will enter into judgment with them there
On behalf of My people and My inheritance, Israel,
Whom they have scattered among the nations;
And they have divided up My land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have also cast lots for My people,
Traded a boy for a prostitute,
And sold a girl for wine so that they may drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, what are you to Me, Tyre, Sidon, and all the regions of Philistia? Are you repaying Me with retribution? But if you are showing Me retribution, swiftly and speedily I will return your retribution on your head!
speaker: Narrator

text: Since you have taken My silver and My gold, brought My precious treasures to your temples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and sold the sons of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks in order to remove them far from their territory,
speaker: Narrator

text: behold, I am going to stir them up from the place where you have sold them, and return your retribution on your head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will also sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the sons of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, to a distant nation,” for the Lord has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Proclaim this among the nations:
Prepare for holy war; stir up the warriors!
Have all the soldiers come forward, have them come up!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hurry and come, all you surrounding nations,
And gather yourselves there.
Bring down, Lord, Your warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the nations be awakened
And come up to the Valley of Jehoshaphat,
For there I will sit to judge
All the surrounding nations.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision!
For the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun and moon have become dark,
And the stars have lost their brightness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord roars from Zion
And utters His voice from Jerusalem,
And the heavens and the earth quake.
But the Lord is a refuge for His people,
And a stronghold for the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then you will know that I am the Lord your God,
Dwelling on Zion, My holy mountain.
So Jerusalem will be holy,
And strangers will no longer pass through it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And on that day
The mountains will drip with sweet wine,
And the hills will flow with milk,
And all the brooks of Judah will flow with water;
And a spring will go out from the house of the Lord
And water the Valley of Shittim.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt will become a wasteland,
And Edom will become a desolate wilderness,
Because of the violence done to the sons of Judah,
In whose land they have shed innocent blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Judah will be inhabited forever,
And Jerusalem for all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will avenge their blood which I have not avenged,
For the Lord dwells in Zion.
speaker: Narrator
